attributes.title: Stock verification
attributes.description: The findings revealed a cumulative bread variance of +22 loaves, surplus of 1 bag of white ingredients and polybags had a cumulative variance of -536 pieces.
attributes.recommendation: More stringent controls need to be adopted to reduce the overall stock variances.

value: We will follow up on the cause of excess ingredients and improve on our controls to curb stock variances.
I will improve on the noted areas.
In the previous audit, the finished products had a cumulative shortfall of 262 loaves and polybags had a positive variance of 745 pieces.
A stock take exercise was conducted on 10th June 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.
Variances noted in the ingredients and polybags is an indication that stock controls are not effective.

attributes.title: Bread weight check
attributes.description:
All sample varieties had minimal cases of underweight.                             
The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 07%, 400g W-03% and 800g W- 04%.

value: We will continue making improvements.
To be maintained
Minimal cases of underweight were noted in the previous audit spot check.
Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
Minimal cases of underweight is an indication that production standards are observed.

attributes.title: Damages analysis
attributes.description:
A total of 864 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.26% of the total loaves produced.                        
                        
1242.75 loaves were damaged under market damages representing 0.37% of the total sales over the audited period. The total damged bread exceed the set limit by 602 loaves worth Ksh. 32,207.
attributes.recommendation: The management to ensure that quality bread is dispatch to the market to reduce cases of market returns.

value: This was contributed by low sales, we will work to reduce bread damages.
We will put more efforts to reduce bread damages.
The previous audit findings indicated that market damages exceeded the set limit by 112 loaves.
Analysis of bread damages from 20.05.25 – 09.06.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the set limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.
Both production and market damages were maintained within the set limits indicating that the company is not exposed to losses due to damages.

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description: The cash count exercise  revealed no material variances between the physical cash on hand and the book balance.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should ensure that petty cash records and balances are well maintained.

value: The positive trend will be maintained.
The positive trend will be maintained.
No variances were reported in the cash office in the previous audit findings.
A spot check was conducted at the branch cash office to assess the adequacy of cash handling practices and if proper records were maintained.
The immaterial variance noted in cash office is an indication that effective controls are in place.

attributes.title: Minishop spot-checks
attributes.description: Both shop attendants accurately accounted for their stock and no variances were noted. Stock records were well maintained and aligned with physical counts.
attributes.recommendation: The branch to continue following Minishop management SOPs.

value: We will maintain the trend trend by ensuring that SOPs are adhered to.
Minishop SOPs will always be observed.
No variances were noted in previous audit spot-checks.
Spot checks were conducted at the Majengo and Tudor branch minishops to assess whether operations were being carried out in compliance with the company’s SOPs
Proper accountability in minishops is an indication that stock controls practices are being adhered to as per company policy.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
The branch hired a total of 375 workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 1,688 bags.                        
                        
The actual production was 1,652 bags leading to a production shortfall of 36 bags and an actual efficiency of 4.41 bags per worker which is below the target.
attributes.recommendation: Management to improve on the planning of production workers to ensure that the set efficiency is consistently achieved.

value: The efficiency was affected by slicer machine breakdown, leading to delay release of baking tins.
We will improve
The production shortfall reported in the previous audit findings was 45 bags.
Production efficiency was analyzed from 20.05.25 – 09.06.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiency of 4.5 bags per worker.
The actual labour cost exceeded the budget by Ksh. 8,688 leading to increased production cost.

attributes.title: Packaging Efficiency
attributes.description:
The total good bread produced over the audited period is 23,528 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 243 workers.                                 
                                
A total of 259 workers were hired leading to extra 16 workers and an actual efficiency of 90.8 crates per worker which is below the set limit.
attributes.recommendation: Management improve on the planning of packaging workers to ensure that the set efficiency is always achieved.

value: This was contributed by frequent slicing machine breakdown. We are working to ensure that the set efficiency is always achieved.
Drop in efficiency was contributed by machine breakdown and we promise to improve.
The packaging efficiency reported in the previous audit findings was 91.5 crates per worker. Still the efficiency was below the set target
Packaging efficiency were analyzed from 20.05.25 – 09.06.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiency of 97 crates per worker.
The set efficiency was not achieved indicating that pakaging costs incurred exceeded the budget by Ksh.14,592.

attributes.title: Delivery vehicle fuel usage analysis
attributes.description:
Analysis was done for the two vehicles assigned to the branch KCN 885L and KCW 089A. Comparison of the actual fuel used and the standard fuel revealed immaterial variances.                        
                        
No material variance between the actual fuel used and the set standards.
attributes.recommendation: The set controls on fuel usage should be strictly adhered.

value: We will maintain
The positive trend will be maintained.
Fuel consumption was within the range for the two vehicles in the previous audit findings.
Analysis of fuel consumption by the delivery vehicle was done for the month of May 2025 to verify if their consumption rate is within the set standards.
Fuel consumption rates are within the range indicating that fuel controls are being observed.

attributes.title: Generator Fuel analysis
attributes.description:
The generator had run for 3.31 hours and used 160 litres of fuel over the period from 1st May to 31st May 2025.
The average rate of fuel consumption was 48.3 L/Hr which is within the range.

value: To be maintained.
To be maintained.
The average fuel consumption rate reported in the previous audit findings was 45.3 L/Hr.

Review of generator fuel usage and machine hours records was done to ascertain that its use is as per the set policies.
Standard fuel consumption for the branch generator was 65 L/Hr
No material variance is noted indicating that proper generator controls are in place.
